description: Single and two storey rear extension; first floor side extension; single storey front infill extension; infill of front entrance canopy and alterations to front gable; alterations and extension to raise roof height; rooflights in rear and both side roofslopes; conversion of garage to habitable room with installation of windows to front; external alterations
decision_conditions:
The window(s) in the west flank elevation(s) of the proposed development shall:
(a) be of purpose-made obscure glass,
(b) be permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level,
and shall thereafter be retained in that form.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: MTL-02-101 Revision 1st; MTL-02-102 Revision A; MTL-02-103
Revision 1st; Reasonable Exception Statement.<p class="MsoNormal"><o:p></o:p></p>

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevations of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.

The development hereby permitted shall not commence until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces noted below have been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority:
(a) the extension/building(s)
(b) the ground surfacing
(c) the boundary treatment
The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and shall thereafter be retained.
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
